intro: Impatiens gagei, commonly known as the Gage's Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the tips of the stems. Impatiens gagei thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
